main event: Wing Commander TODKILL observed an extremely bright and luminous unidentified object over Terrigal, New South Wales, Australia on 20th January, 1953.
interesting points: The object hung motionless for about 30 seconds before moving rapidly in a northerly direction for approximately 10 miles., The object's brightness was compared to that of a welded arc., The object remained at a constant height throughout its movement., Weather conditions were clear with maximum visibility., Wing Commander TODKILL, a technical officer, suspected the object to be a large meteorite due to its path and brightness.
sighted object: extremely bright and luminous object in the sky
witness description: Wing Commander TODKILL, a member of the R.A.A.F. since 1939, and a technical officer well acquainted with aircraft and equipment.
